View Device Summary Information

  1. Use any of the following ways to access the Device Summary window:
    • Log into the PW EMS, this window displays by default.
    • From the navigation bar, click Dashboard.
    • From the navigation bar, click Devices > Device Summary.
  2. In the Device Summary window, view fields described in the following figure:
  3. Click the Optional Columns drop-down list to configure columns shown in the Device Summary table. You can add or remove columns by checking or unchecking the check box next to each column. Default columns are noted in the table.

    Column

    Description
    Region Displays the configured geographical region in which this vBBU site exists.
    Site (Default) Displays the specific location of the vBBU.
    vBBU (Default) Displays the user-friendly name of the vBBU.
    vBBU ID (Default) Displays the device ID of the vBBU.
    vBBU Status Displays the connectivity status of this vBBU.
    vNode and vNode ID Displays the vNode ID and serial number.
    Software Version Displays the software version of the vBBU or vNode.
    vNode Status Displays the connectivity status of the vNode con-tainers for the vBBU.
    HNG Displays the default service type (GSM or LTE) that is running on the connected HNG device.
    LTE Service Displays the Virtual eNodeB (VeNB) profile instance for a cell that is used for LTE service on a vNode.
    GSM Service Displays the 2G Global System for Mobile Communications (GSM) profile instance for a cell that is used for GSM service on a vNode.
    GPRS Service Displays the General Packet Radio Service (GPRS) profile instance for a cell that is used for 2G and 3G service on a vNode. This profile instance is used typically for packet-oriented mobile data.
    Cell Name Displays the user-defined name of the 4G LTE or 2G cell.
    Service Type Displays the service type (GSM or LTE) of the vNode.
    Cell Version Displays the version of software running on the vNode.
    Cell Status Displays the cell status of the vNode as In-Service or Out-Of-Service.
    EARFCN Displays the E-UTRA Absolute Radio Frequency Channel Number (EARFCN) for the country of operation.
    PCI Displays the Physical Cell ID (PCI) number for the LTE access node cell.
    RSI Displays the root sequence index (RSI) neighboring cells.
    TAC Displays the Tracking Area Code (TAC) that indicates the traffic area in which an eNodeB (eNB) belongs. This TAC is unique within a PLMN.
    LAC Displays the four-digit hexadecimal value (0 to 9, a to f, A to F) GSM Location Area Code (LAC) ID.
    RAC Displays the two-digit hexadecimal value (0 to 9, a to f, A to F) Routing Area Code (RAC) ID.
    PLMN Displays the the 5 to 6 digit Public Land Mobile Network (PLMN) wireless communications system identifier (ID).
    ECI Displays the eNodeB Cell ID (ECI) number associated with this access node (cell) that is included in the SON configuration.
    RS POWER Displays the Reference Signal Received Power (RSRP), which is the power of the LTE Reference Signals spread over the full bandwidth and narrowband.
    Total Power Displays the total power of the Remote Radio Head (RRH) or Remote Radio Unit (RRU).
  4. Check the check box in a row and click the Actions column button to access operational and configuration details about a vBBU server and its associated devices, or to reboot a vBBU or vNode. Refer to the following sections for more information about these device actions.
  • Access vBBU Operational Details through the Device Summary Window
    Use this task to navigate to the vBBU Details window from the Device Summary window to view vBBU operational information.
  • Perform a Bulk Reboot Action on Devices
    Use this task to perform a bulk reboot action on one or more vBBU, vNode, and cells.
  • Perform a Bulk Update Action on a vBBU
    Use this task to perform a bulk update action on one or more vBBUs.
  • Perform a Bulk Update Action on a vNode
    Use this task to perform a bulk update action on one or more vNodes, and their respective cells. Changes to all tabs are covered in this task, however you can make bulk updates only to the tabs that apply to your parameter configuration changes.
  • Access vNode Operational Details through the Device Summary Window
    Use this task to navigate to the Node Details window from the Device Summary window to view vNode operational information.
  • View and Manage vBBU Configuration Details
    Use this task to view configuration information about the vBBU server, and manage high-level vBBU server-related parameters.
  • View and Manage vNode Configuration Details
    Use this task to view configuration information for a vNode, and manage vNode parameters.
  • Reboot a vBBU
    Use this task to reboot a vBBU and its vNodes and associated cells.
  • Reboot a vNode
    Use this task to reboot a vNode only or a vNode and its associated cells.
Parent topic: Device Configuration and Management
